ai.summary: Long Walk is a 6.3 km moderate hike in the UK suitable for walkers with moderate fitness. The route typically weaves through a mix of country paths, woodland, and open countryside, with gradual climbs and some uneven sections. It's well-suited for a half-day outing and offers a steady pace with rewarding views.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of well-defined footpaths, grassy lanes, and some uneven ground. The hike may include short sections of woodland trail, gentle ascents, and potential muddy patches after rain. Footwear with good grip and a waterproof layer are advised.
ai.safety_notes: Check local weather and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy hiking boots with good grip and bring waterproof clothing. Stay on marked paths, keep to a comfortable pace, and bring water. Carry a map or navigation device and a charged phone. Be mindful of livestock and wildlife, and be prepared for sudden changes in weather typical of the UK.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April–October) for milder weather and better daylight; winter hikes are possible but require extra caution.
